page.title: 03SCHOOL FIFTY YEARS AGO
page.content: FIFTY YEARS AGO SHIELDAIG PRIMARY SCHOOL WAS A VERY DIFFERENT PLACE. THE CHILDREN WALKED FROM MILES AROUND TO ATTEND SCHOOL. THE SCHOOLROOM ITSELF HAD ONLY VERY BASIC EQUIPMENT - A BLACKBOARD, COPY BOOKS AND DESKS. THE ROOM WAS HEATED BY A FIRE IN THE CORNER. THE DESK SEATS WERE JOINED TO THE WRITING TOP AND RAISED WHEN YOU STOOD UP. THE USUAL PROJECT WOULD BE NATURE STUDY, BUT THEY ALSO HAD ART AND SEWING BESIDES THE BASIC SUBJECTS. ONCE A YEAR THE SCHOOL INSPECTOR WOULD COME TO SEE THAT BOTH TEACHER AND CHILDREN WERE DOING WELL. YOU COULD STAY ON AT SCHOOL UNTIL YOU WERE FOURTEEN. IF YOU STAYED ON FOR FURTHER EDUCATION YOU WENT AS A BOARDER TO DINGWALL ACADEMY. THE PUNISHMENT FOR BEING NAUGHTY WAS 'THE BELT'
